H0.text: Binary fission is the method by which prokaryotes can reproduce quickly.

H1.text: Multiple fission is the process by which prokaryotes can reproduce quickly.

H2.text: Solar fission is the process by which prokaryotes can reproduce quickly.

H3.text: Residual fission is the method by which prokaryotes can reproduce quickly.

A4.text: Binary fission is generally rapid, though its speed varies between species.

A5.text: For E. coli, cells typically divide about every 20 minutes at 37 Â°C.
